testHelp

Class ExecutableAssertion

  • Object
    • ExecutableAssertion
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CallableAssertion, RunnableAssertion

    public abstract class ExecutableAssertion
extends Object
    Represents an assertion about some executable piece of code (Callable or Runnable, in Java terms).

    For example, imagine you have a constructor and you want to verify that it does not throw exceptions. You can write something like verify.that(() -> { Car c = new Car(); }).doesNotThrow();. The () -> { ... } syntax is called a lambda and enables you to pass code around as if it were an object.

    Author:
    ejewart

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ExecutableAssertion(String subjectDesc)
      Construct the base class part of an Assertion type derived from the class Stores subjectDesc but not subject itself, but not subject itself, which is a function and can't be stored because there is not type that is assignable from all function types.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ExecutableAssertion doesNotThrow()
      Verifies that a snippet of code does not throw any exceptions.
      (package private) abstract void execute()
      Abstract method for executing the executable snippet, needs to be overridden in all derived classes.
      ExceptionAssertion throwsException()
      Verifies that the snippet of code throws an exception.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExecutableAssertion

        public ExecutableAssertion(String subjectDesc)
        Construct the base class part of an Assertion type derived from the class Stores subjectDesc but not subject itself, but not subject itself, which is a function and can't be stored because there is not type that is assignable from all function types.
        Parameters:
        subjectDesc - description of executable function object - required

    • Method Detail

      • throwsException

        public ExceptionAssertion throwsException()
        Verifies that the snippet of code throws an exception.
        Returns:
        an ExceptionAssertion containing the exception that was thrown, so you can verify things about that Exception
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if no exception was thrown

      • doesNotThrow

        public ExecutableAssertion doesNotThrow()
        Verifies that a snippet of code does not throw any exceptions.
        Returns:
        this (an instance of a derived assertion type but statically typed as ExecutableAssertion) if executing the code snippet does not throw an exception
        Throws:
        AssertionError - if executing the code snippet does throw an exception

      • execute

        abstract void execute()
        Abstract method for executing the executable snippet, needs to be overridden in all derived classes. It doesn't take arguments or return a value or throw an exception. Implementations can do all those things, but they must do it within the call and use instance variables to store arguments, return value and exception.
